column3: Latest;Phnom Penh: A man’s body was found on November 22
column4: 2019 7 am in the Tonle Sap River
column6: Khan Daun Penh Phnom Penh.------Authorities said the unidentified male
column7: was 179-centimeters tall and was a foreigner (*no more details).------UPDATE: A source has told CNE that the body was white
column8: aged around 50 with a white/gray beard.------Police and specialists arrived at the scene to examine the body.------As a result
column9: law enforcement coalition confirmed that the body had severe head injuries (*possibly as a result of suicide).------After the review
column10: the body was taken to Wat Stung Stung Mean Chey 1 pending further investigation into the identity. ------SOURCE
